How can I install a file tar.gz?: You don't install a tar.gz file. What you do with it depends on its contents.
tar zxf the-file.tar.gz to unpack it. :)
My problem is that I never remember the command to unpack a file
Just do 'man 1 tar' the next time. At the bottom there are a few examples. :)
z = gzip, x = extract, f = file. It's the command tar executes.
See 'man 1 tar' for details. It's all explained there.
Yes, and you're tar is gzipped, so add the z: tar zxf file.tar.gz (the - is optional).
tar zxf is not a universal command for each file .tar?
Read the man page. It explains it.
which is the difference between tar and gzip?
